definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party

sentences.english: It's out duty to maintain ([men'tein] ) the public order.
sentences.chinese: 维护公共秩序是我们的职责。

sentences.english: Crowds of people are often seen as bad for public order.
sentences.chinese: 人群常常被看作是对公共秩序的一种威胁。

sentences.english: Please abide by the regulations and obey directions given by library staff.
sentences.chinese: 请自觉遵守公共秩序和国家图书馆各项管理规定。

sentences.english: Special Secretariat for the Under-Secretary of the Public Order and others at large.
sentences.chinese: 公共秩序特别秘书处行动副秘书等人在逃。

sentences.english: The Government shares the growing national concern about public-order problems resulting from binge drinking.
sentences.chinese: 政府和全国人民一样关注酗酒导致的公共秩序问题。

sentences.english: Violative of public order or good morals;
sentences.chinese: 五妨害公共秩序或善良风俗者。

sentences.english: It is one of the duties of the police to preserve public order.
sentences.chinese: 警察的职责之一是维持公共秩序。

pinyin: she4 hui4 gong1 gong4 li4 yi4
